text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how I make my individual pear
crostata now this is a great go-to
recipe when you have a couple pairs that
just aren't ripe enough to eat on their
own you're gonna cook them down a little
bit to release their flavor this is a
great recipe for that so the ingredients
for it's super simple and easy so let me
take you over them to get started you're
gonna need a couple of pairs they're
just peeled and cored and sliced some
golden raisins a little bit of sugar
tiny bit of cinnamon a beat egg and some
pie crust that you can make your own pie
crust and if you want a great recipe

really fantastic go through a pie crust

you can just buy some at the supermarket
I always have tons of pie crusts in my

case you know someone comes over

and I've got myself pie crusts on hand
so this is how it's gonna go you want to
bring your of it to 400 get that ready I
have a baking sheet with those parchment
paper on top just to get that to not
stick and now here's your going to do
I'm going to make two one for my husband
and one for myself you could make a big

this little Bowl

so now that I've got that toss together

we go so now I'm gonna do try to

I'm gonna do is just take my little

but it's also gonna help it brown so
just do that all around the edges and
then I'm gonna just like my apple

it does not have to be perfect it does
not have to be neat you just want to
